item.title: There Are No Mahayana Monasteries
item.description: Photo by Raju Kumar on Unsplash Introduction It has become all too common these days to refer to Buddhist monasteries (by which I mean established communities of monks or nuns that maintain traditional Vinaya observance) by their cultural flair or the doctrinal views they follow. We may call some monasteries “Tibetan”, or “Zen”, “Theravāda”, or even “Mahāyāna” or “Hīnayāna” (i.e. Śrāvakayāna). While it may seem to make sense, these labels create unnecessary barriers between monastics who are actually much closer spiritual siblings than it may appear.
